  "description": "Promise Land Building &amp; Construction Limited is a dynamic Nigerian construction and real estate firm committed to delivering affordable, high-quality housing and infrastructure solutions across the country. With a focus on excellence and community impact, we transform visions into enduring structures.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Manage full-cycle accounting processes, including accounts payable/receivable, bank reconciliations, and general ledger maintenance.
	Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, budgets, cash flow forecasts, and variance analyses.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian tax laws (e.g., VAT, PAYE, WHT, CIT), statutory filings, and construction-specific regulations like withholding taxes on contracts.
	Track project costs, overheads, and profitability for construction projects, providing cost-to-complete analyses and financial reporting to management.
	Handle payroll processing, employee deductions, and pension contributions while maintaining strict confidentiality.
	Liaise with auditors, tax authorities, and banks to support audits, resolve discrepancies, and optimize financial processes.
	Implement internal controls to safeguard assets, prevent fraud, and ensure accurate financial reporting.
	Prepare management reports, KPIs, and financial dashboards to support strategic decision-making.
	Manage vendor payments, invoice processing, and procurement financial approvals.
	Support budgeting for new projects and monitor expenditure against approved limits.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3-5 years of post-NYSC accounting experience, preferably in construction/real estate or SME environments.
	ICAN certification is an added advantage (must be in progress or certified).
	Preference for married female candidates with strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, ERP systems) and advanced MS Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP).
	In-depth knowledge of Nigerian GAAP, tax regulations, and construction industry financial practices.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills; ability to work under pressure.


Behavioral Competence and Requirements:


	This candidate must have the energy, intellect, and excitement to take on a work-in-process process and help to continually iterate to achieve industry excellence.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet constantly changing time-lines.
	Be able to travel as necessary, and perform, additional job-related duties as requested.

	Ability to work independently, initiative, and remain flexible in an ever-changing environment.
	Fast learner with interest in a broad range of business functions.
	Possesses an astute attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.


Salary and Benefits


	Competitive Remuneration
	Career Growth
	Opportunity to shape Nigeria&#39;s built environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Accountant Job at Promise Land Building & Construction Limited




        
    

        
        Promise Land Building & Construction Limited is a dynamic Nigerian construction and real estate firm committed to delivering affordable, high-quality housing and infrastructure solutions across the country. Specializing in residential developments, commercial projects, and sustainable building practices, we prioritize innovation, client satisfaction, and timely execution to make homeownership accessible for every Nigerian. With a focus on excellence and community impact, we transform visions into enduring structures.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage full-cycle accounting processes, including accounts payable/receivable, bank reconciliations, and general ledger maintenance.
	Prepare accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements, budgets, cash flow forecasts, and variance analyses.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian tax laws (e.g., VAT, PAYE, WHT, CIT), statutory filings, and construction-specific regulations like withholding taxes on contracts.
	Track project costs, overheads, and profitability for construction projects, providing cost-to-complete analyses and financial reporting to management.
	Handle payroll processing, employee deductions, and pension contributions while maintaining strict confidentiality.
	Liaise with auditors, tax authorities, and banks to support audits, resolve discrepancies, and optimize financial processes.
	Implement internal controls to safeguard assets, prevent fraud, and ensure accurate financial reporting.
	Prepare management reports, KPIs, and financial dashboards to support strategic decision-making.
	Manage vendor payments, invoice processing, and procurement financial approvals.
	Support budgeting for new projects and monitor expenditure against approved limits.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	3-5 years of post-NYSC accounting experience, preferably in construction/real estate or SME environments.
	ICAN certification is an added advantage (must be in progress or certified).
	Preference for married female candidates with strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, ERP systems) and advanced MS Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP).
	In-depth knowledge of Nigerian GAAP, tax regulations, and construction industry financial practices.
	Excellent analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills; ability to work under pressure.


Behavioral Competence and Requirements:


	This candidate must have the energy, intellect, and excitement to take on a work-in-process process and help to continually iterate to achieve industry excellence.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet constantly changing time-lines.
	Be able to travel as necessary, and perform, additional job-related duties as requested.
	Excellent verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
	Ability to work independently, initiative, and remain flexible in an ever-changing environment.
	Fast learner with interest in a broad range of business functions.
	Possesses an astute attention to detail and excellent problem-solving skills.


Salary and Benefits


	Competitive Remuneration
	Career Growth
	Opportunity to shape Nigeria's built environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: felixebos96@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Workforce Management (WFM) Analyst Job at Mwanga Limited




        
    

        
        Mwanga is a pioneer tech-driven debt recovery and business support outsourcing company with a vision to be the leading extension to global teams in Africa. We started our pilot operations in 2018 with a small agile team and have scaled impressively since then in results and team becoming trusted by key players for recoveries in Nigeria. We offer business support to businesses with the aim of helping them scale using ethical and innovative technology strategies. We are trusted by Africa’s leading lenders to recover their outstanding debts and to scale our impact. We provide a range of services ranging from debt recovery, telemarketing, call center outsourcing, virtual assistant services, customer support services, and data analysis.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Workforce Management (WFM) Analyst

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Workforce Management (WFM) Analyst to ensure optimal staffing levels across our operations.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for forecasting workload, scheduling staff, monitoring real-time performance, and providing data-driven insights to support operational efficiency and service delivery.


Key Responsibilities


	Forecast workload and staffing requirements using historical data and trends
	Create and manage staff schedules to meet business demand
	Monitor real-time operations and make necessary adjustments to ensure service levels
	Track schedule adherence, attendance, and productivity
	Prepare WFM reports on performance, utilization, and forecast accuracy
	Collaborate with HR and Operations on hiring, training, and capacity planning
	Support peak planning and special projects as required


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc. qualification.
	1–2 years of experience in Workforce Management, Planning, or Operations (call center experience.
	Knowledge of Call Centre Metrics (e.g., Service Level, ASA, AHT, Occupancy, Adherence, Shrinkage, Forecast Accuracy).
	Strong proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets.
	Ability to analyze data and present insights clearly.
	Data analysis & reporting skills, good communication skill, strong attention to detail, problem-solving ability and stakeholder management skills.
	Workforce forecasting & scheduling
	Must reside in Maryland, Lagos or nearby environs

title: Job Vacancies at Arab Space Nigeria Limited
content:
Arab Space Nigeria Limited is growing real estate company focused on property sales and real estate services. We help individuals and investors access verified properties while promoting transparency, structure, and professionalism in real estate transactions.

Our work environment encourages learning, accountability, team work, and performance-based growth. Team members are given clear responsibilities, proper supervision, and opportunities to grow as the company expands.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Manager / Team Lead

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	ArabSpaceNG is seeking an experienced Sales Manager to lead our sales team, drive property sales, and support the company’s growth strategy.


Responsibilities


	??Lead and supervise the sales team
	??Assign leads and manage sales targets
	?Train and onboard new sales staff and freelance agents
	??Track performance and prepare sales reports
	??Improve deal closure and conversion rates.


Requirements


	?Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or related field
	?Minimum of 3 years of sales experience (real estate preferred)
	?At least 1 year of experience managing a sales team
	?Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets
	?Strong knowledge of the Nigerian real estate market
	Strong negotiation and leadership skills.


Salary & Benefits


	?N180,000 monthly salary
	?50% commission on personal sales profit.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hrarabspace@gmail.com using  the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Videographer / Content Creator

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos (Hybrid)

Key Responsibilities


	?Produce property photos and videos
	?Create walkthrough and reel content
	??Support educational and branding videos
	?Manage content, equipment and archives
	Support marketing campaigns


Requirements


	?Minimum 2 years of experience in videography/photography (real estatepreferred)
	?Strong video editing and photo retouching skills
	?Experience creating short-form video content for Instagram and social media
	?Good understanding of branding and visual storytelling
	??Own a professional camera and basic lighting equipment
	?Portfolio of previous work.



Salary & Benefits


	?N200,000 monthly salary
	?N10,000 data allowance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: hrarabspace@gmail.com using the Job Position a subject of the mail.

 

3.) Accountant

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid – one day per week on-site)

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented Accountant to manage financial records, track income and expenses, compute sales commissions, and prepare basic financial reports to support business operations and management decisions.


Key Responsibilities


	?Record and maintain accurate financial transactions
	??Prepare invoices and track client payments
	??Compute sales commissions and support payroll processing
	??Track operational expenses and process expense claims
	??Prepare monthly income and expense reports
	??Maintain proper financial documentation and confidentiality


Requirements


	?Qualification in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	2–3 years of accounting experience
	????Experience with SMEs or service-based businesses
